intro: Sida brachystachys, commonly known as small-stemmed sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial species belonging to the Malvaceae family. The plant features small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of tiny, pale yellow to greenish flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Sida brachystachys is sometimes used in traditional medicine and has potential ecological applications.
